item.description:
From Gerrish Island Lane, turn right onto Pocohontas Road and proceed 1.1 miles.  You will pass Whaleback Drive on you right and then keep right at the fork (the left fork is a driveway for private houses).  Proceed about another 330 feet or so.  You will come to a gate house and the road will be gated closed.  At this time of year you will have to simply park on the side of the road and walk past the gate.  We can congregate just past the gate house so we don't have to worry about the dogs running lose in traffic..

 

Day       High    Tide          Height    Sunrise      Moon   Time        % Moon
              /Low   Time         Feet       Sunset                                   Visible

Su  18    Low     2:27 AM    0.8         6:49 AM     Rise    4:32 AM    21
      18    High    8:39 AM    9.1          6:53 PM     Set      3:12 PM
      18    Low     3:09 PM    0.1
      18    High    9:18 PM    8.6

This outing/hike is set a little later in the day so we will get there closer to low tide rather than high tide so that more of the beach will be exposed and the water will be lower compared to if we went there closer to high tide.

This trip isn't so much about going on a longer hike to get more exercise as it is about going on a shorter hike and enjoying the views along the seacoast/beach.  Of course there is always the possibility of any one wanting more exercise to walk the route twice.

For those who might be interested we could set up a car pool near exit 1 off of Rt. 101 in Manchester if enough people show an interest in doing so in the comment section below.
item.how_to_find_us: Drive past the indicated address. At this time of year the park gate will be closed. Simply park on the road near the park gate/toll both. We can gather just inside the park gate away from the cars

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Fort Foster - Kittery Point, ME
